people.name: Gustav Holst
people.description: Gustav Theodore Holst  was an English composer, arranger and teacher.

people.name: Public Broadcasting Service
people.description: The Public Broadcasting Service  is an American public broadcaster and television program distributor.

people.name: Max Newman
people.description: Maxwell Herman Alexander "Max" Newman, FRS  was a British mathematician and codebreaker.

people.name: George Dyson
people.description: George Dyson  is an American non-fiction author and historian of technology whose publications broadly cover the evolution of technology in relation to the physical environment and the direction of society.

people.name: Hilary Putnam
people.description: Hilary Whitehall Putnam  was an American philosopher, mathematician, and computer scientist, and a major figure in analytic philosophy in the second half of the 20th century.

people.name: Barry Mazur
people.description: Barry Charles Mazur  is an American mathematician and a Gerhard Gade University Professor at Harvard University.

people.name: Phillip Griffiths
people.description: Phillip Augustus Griffiths IV  is an American mathematician, known for his work in the field of geometry, and in particular for the complex manifold approach to algebraic geometry.

people.name: John Milnor
people.description: John Willard Milnor  is an American mathematician known for his work in differential topology, K-theory and dynamical systems.

items.name: Chern Medal
items.description: It is a photograph about Chern Medal. In a corner, it says:The Chern Medal is an international award recognizing outstanding lifelong achievement of the highest level in the field of mathematics.   There are things written behind: Phillip Griffiths   And the following place: Raleigh, North Carolina

items.name: Fields Medal
items.description: It is a letter about Fields Medal. It says: The Fields Medal is a prize awarded to two, three, or four mathematicians under 40 years of age at the International Congress of the International Mathematical Union , a meeting that takes place every four years.   The following people are mentioned:  John Milnor   And the following place: Orange, New Jersey
